intro: Labatia odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented labatia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and emit a fragrant aroma. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Labatia odorata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance.
